page.title: 18OLDBURY, COWHILL AND KINGTON
page.content: {Oldbury church}is situated on a hill on the outskirts of{Oldbury village. The village used to be where{Cowhill is now but everyone died in the {plague.}A blocked up door within the church faces Cowhill and was for the use of those villagers. There is also a tunnel linking the church to St {Arild's House.}This was used for smuggling when the{River Severn}flowed much closer to the church than it does now. This tunnel follows a straight line and does not wiggle like the road. People had forgotten about its existance until a tractor fell into it a few years ago. {Kington}means "place of cows". Two years ago there were lots of cows but now there are very few. One KM square has no people living in it at all, despite being so close to towns and villages. Any barns are tumbled down.
